page.title: 20Wildlife/Schools Taking Part
page.content: Bedgrove being a small place does not have much varying landscape and wildlife,but what it has is very interesting.There is a pond which has two mallard ducks on it.Also we have a spinney where squirrels and other creatures dwell. In Halton there is the canal.Many birds nest there such as a pair of mute swans,coots,moorhens,and mallard ducks. Being in the country means having rabbits,foxes and hedgehogs. Owls,kestrels,sparrowhawks,and woodpeckers are common visitors in our area. The following schools have been responsible for this data. Class 7 Weston Turville C/E Combined School. Bedgrove First School. Bedgrove Middle School.
